author: Vexing Rabbit
comment: @Ar Ash cause I'm sick of people that think whatever they watch is a masterpiece.    What does that have to do with me? I already stated that I never watched this show,  re-read my comment before replying. I simply want people to watch something without someone like you deciding what's good or bad. Because I'm sick of authoritarians deciding on what people should think of something instead people making their own choice. It may be crap to you but someone else can think it's great.   Now again if you have a reply please make a mature discussion rather an angry one. I think people have a right to think whatever they want instead being told to. Change my mind.

author: Pervy Demon
comment: Well, it has some good moments, it's realistic for a fantasy anime and the plot is interesting, visuals are above average and it looks like they put a lot of effort in it but... it's like that something is missing, the soul of the plot so to say, and it's fast paced in the end, lack of motion of the animation, a plot hole that they didn' t give a conclusion to main characters father, where the hell is he so to speak. Im neither dissapointed nor am I not dissapointed, strange, hehe

author: Lexyvil
comment: It's an anime adaptation of a game made in 1996. It's about a guy called Takuya who finds a device sent to him by mail by his late historian father that allows him to travel in parallel worlds to find answers of his father's passing.  The anime feels way too rushed though and crammed, I highly suggest the original game. It innovated the use of a flowchart and even Steins;Gate was inspired by it. Look up Yu-No: The Girl who Chants Love at the Edge of the World (the TLWIKI English Fan-Translation), that or add my Discord if you want me to send you the PC version: Lexyvil#1805
